Articles.Content:
[nope]

Edited October 30, 2016 by GregroxMun

And for science you have to collect them all.

Beware of the Kraken!!!
Do Kerbals have the tale of the insane captain Kahab, who lost one of his legs to a giant snow-white kraken and now seeks revenge against the mighty beast in orbit around Laythe?
Pretty sure the devs have said on several occasions that there won't be any lifeforms alien to Kerbin in KSP...

It would be interesting to have birdstrike "issues" now and then

Imagine if you hit a high-flier at mach 2... not fun.

Edited January 7, 2014 by draeath

Could be pretty fun, but I do not see that happen.

And a little thing to your list.

Bloaters are big creatures floating around in the upper layers of the Joolian atmosphere thanks to their massive air-sacks filled whit hydrogen. They have a strong but light exoskeleton-like skin that protect them against extreme temperatures, winds and radiation. Apart from the whole floaty thing they look a lot like the Khvales of the Kerbin oceans. They are very rare, and make a beautiful serene song. They give birth to living cubs, who, even though they spend two years inside their mothers growing a strong hide, are very small when they get born.

They can live for thousands of years, because they don't really age. All this time, they keep their slow growth going, and they can reach enormous sizes. They however rarely live that long, as the environment in the Joolian atmosphere is dangerous. They feed of plankton-like organic materials floating around in the skies. They may very well be at least semi-sentient, as they have very big brains, and as they seem to respond to each others songs.

Pretty sure the devs have said on several occasions that there won't be any lifeforms alien to Kerbin in KSP...

I Know, but they don't have to have life forms. That doesn't mean there aren't any in the canon.
I would like to see these little guys slithering near the coast.

Mammaloids: Similar to mammals, in that they give live birth and feed young using a fluid. The fluid is a sticky blue substance that is very nutritious. Like Earth mammals, the "milk" tastes different depending on the species of animal it comes from.

Wait, is this sticky substance... special? As in... the Blue Milk Special? *grins*

I would love to see a Kraken passing by my SS2 (Space Station 2)

 

Although my hard work would be obliterated in seconds.
